 8	import java.time.Duration;
 9	
 10	public class DriverManager extends BaseTest {
 11	 public static WebDriver webDriver;
 12	 private static String browserMode;
 13	
 14	 public static WebDriver initDriver(String browser){
 15	 ChromeOptions options = new ChromeOptions();
 16	
 17	 if ("true".equalsIgnoreCase(util.getProperty("headless"))) {
 18	 options.addArguments("--headless=new"); // or "--headless" for older Chrome
 19	 // Use new headless mode
 20	 options.addArguments("--window-size=1920,1080");
 21	 options.addArguments("--disable-gpu");
 22	 options.addArguments("--no-sandbox");
 23	 options.addArguments("--disable-dev-shm-usage");
 24	 System.out.println("✅ Headless mode enabled via config.properties");
 25	 browserMode = "Headless";
 26	 } else {
 27	 System.out.println("️ Headless mode disabled. Running with UI.");
 28	 browserMode = "UI";
 29	 }
 30	
 31	 if(browser.equalsIgnoreCase("chrome")){
 32	 webDriver = new ChromeDriver(options);
 33	 }
 34	
 35	 webDriver.manage().window().maximize();
 36	 webDriver.manage().timeouts().implicitlyWait(Duration.ofSeconds(20));
 37	 return webDriver;
 38	 }
 39	 public static String getBrowserMode() {
 40	 return browserMode;
 41	 }
 42	
 43	 public static WebDriver getWebDriver(){
 44	 return webDriver;
 45	 }
 46	}

 59	 public static String generateRandomPassword() {
 60	 StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
 61	 for (int i = 0; i < PASSWORD_LENGTH; i++) {
 62	 sb.append(ALL_CHARS.charAt(random.nextInt(ALL_CHARS.length())));
 63	 }
 64	 return sb.toString();
 65	 }

 67	 public static String generateRandomIndianName() {
 68	 String firstName = INDIAN_FIRST_NAMES.get(random.nextInt(INDIAN_FIRST_NAMES.size()));
 69	 String lastName = INDIAN_SURNAMES.get(random.nextInt(INDIAN_SURNAMES.size()));
 70	 return firstName + " " + lastName;
 71	 }

 73	 public static String generateTestPhoneNumberStartingWith1() {
 74	 StringBuilder phone = new StringBuilder("1");
 75	 for (int i = 0; i < 9; i++) {
 76	 phone.append(random.nextInt(10));
 77	 }
 78	 return phone.toString();
 79	 }

 85	 public static String[] generateValidStateAndCityPair() {

 87	 String selectedState = states.get(random.nextInt(states.size()));

 49	
 50	 if (result.getStatus() == ITestResult.SUCCESS) {
 51	 test.get().pass("Test Passed");

 53	 test.get().fail(result.getThrowable());
 54	 } else if (result.getStatus() == ITestResult.SKIP) {
 55	 test.get().skip("Test Skipped");
 56	 }

 58	 driver.quit();
 59	 }
 60	 }

 43	## ️ Technologies Used
 44	
 45	| Technology | Version | Purpose |
 46	|------------|---------|---------|
 47	| **Java** | 24 | Programming Language |
 48	| **Selenium WebDriver** | 4.33.0 | Web Automation |
 49	| **TestNG** | 7.11.0 | Testing Framework |
 50	| **Maven** | 3.9.9 | Build Tool |

 52	| **WebDriverManager** | 6.1.0 | Driver Management |
 53	| **Log4j** | 2.20.0 | Logging |
 54	| **Lombok** | 1.18.38 | Code Generation |
 55	
 56	## Project Structure
 57	
 58	### Main Source (`src/main/java`)
 59	- **`base/`** - Contains BaseTest class with common setup and teardown methods
 60	- **`pages/`** - Page Object Model classes for each web page
 61	- **`utils/`** - Utility classes for common operations
...
 173	
 174	### ExtentReports
 175	- **Location:** `test-output/AutomationExercise.html`
 176	- **Features:** 
 177	 - Detailed test execution logs
 178	 - Screenshots on failure
 179	 - System information
 180	 - Test duration and status
 181	
 182	### Surefire Reports
 183	- **Location:** `target/surefire-reports/`
 184	- **Format:** XML and TXT reports
 185	
 186	### Logs
 187	- **Location:** `logs/test-log.log`
 188	- **Level:** Configurable via log4j2.xml
 189	
 190	## ✨ Framework Features
 191	
 192	### Page Object Model (POM)
 193	- **Maintainable:** Easy to update locators and methods
 194	- **Reusable:** Page methods can be used across multiple tests
 195	- **Readable:** Clear separation of test logic and page interactions
 196	
 197	### Driver Management
 198	- **Auto-configuration:** Automatic browser setup
 199	- **Headless Support:** Run tests without UI
 200	- **Cross-browser:** Easy to extend for multiple browsers
 201	
 202	### Comprehensive Reporting
 203	- **ExtentReports:** Rich HTML reports with screenshots
 204	- **Logging:** Detailed execution logs
 205	- **Test Metrics:** Pass/Fail statistics and execution time
 206	
 207	### Test Data Generation
 208	- **Dynamic Data:** Random email, name, and address generation
 209	- **Realistic Data:** Indian names, cities, and phone numbers
 210	- **Configurable:** Easy to modify data patterns
 211	
 212	### Email Integration
 213	- **Notifications:** Send test results via email
 214	- **Attachments:** Include reports and logs
 215	- **Configurable:** SMTP settings in properties file
 216

 49	 @AfterMethod
 50	 public void tearDown(ITestResult result){
 51	 String testName = result.getMethod().getMethodName();
 52	
 53	 if (result.getStatus() == ITestResult.SUCCESS) {
 54	 test.get().pass("✅ Test Passed: " + testName);
 55	 } else if (result.getStatus() == ITestResult.FAILURE) {
 56	 // Capture screenshot on failure
 57	 String screenshotPath = ScreenshotUtils.captureFailureScreenshot(driver, testName);
 58	
 59	 // Log failure with screenshot in ExtentReports
 60	 if (screenshotPath != null) {
 61	 try {
 62	 // Attach screenshot to ExtentReports
 63	 test.get().fail("❌ Test Failed: " + testName)
 64	 .fail(result.getThrowable())
 65	 .addScreenCaptureFromPath(screenshotPath, "Failure Screenshot");
 66	 } catch (Exception e) {
 67	 test.get().fail("❌ Test Failed: " + testName)
 68	 .fail(result.getThrowable())
 69	 .fail("Failed to attach screenshot: " + e.getMessage());
 70	 }
 71	 } else {
 72	 test.get().fail("❌ Test Failed: " + testName).fail(result.getThrowable());
 73	 }
 74	 } else if (result.getStatus() == ITestResult.SKIP) {
 75	 test.get().skip("⏭️ Test Skipped: " + testName);
 76	 }
 77	
 78	 if(driver != null){
 79	 driver.quit();
 80	 }
 81	 }

 20	## Overview
 21	
 22	This automation framework is designed to test the [Automation Exercise](https://automationexercise.com) website. It follows industry best practices including Page Object Model (POM), data-driven testing, and comprehensive reporting.
 23	
 24	## ️ Framework Architecture
 25	
 26	```
 27	AutomationExercise/
 28	├── src/
 29	│ ├── main/java/com/akshay/automationexecrices/
 30	│ │ ├── base/ # Base test classes
 31	│ │ ├── pages/ # Page Object Model classes
 32	│ │ └── utils/ # Utility classes
 33	│ └── test/
 34	│ ├── java/ # Test classes
 35	│ └── resources/ # Test resources
 36	├── config/ # Configuration files
 37	├── test-output/ # Test reports
 38	├── logs/ # Application logs
 39	├── pom.xml # Maven dependencies
 40	└── testng.xml # TestNG configuration
 41	```
 42	
 43	## ️ Technologies Used
 44	
 45	| Technology | Version | Purpose |
 46	|------------|---------|---------|
 47	| **Java** | 24 | Programming Language |
 48	| **Selenium WebDriver** | 4.33.0 | Web Automation |
 49	| **TestNG** | 7.11.0 | Testing Framework |
 50	| **Maven** | 3.9.9 | Build Tool |
 51	| **ExtentReports** | 5.1.2 | Test Reporting |
 52	| **WebDriverManager** | 6.1.0 | Driver Management |
 53	| **Log4j** | 2.20.0 | Logging |
 54	| **Lombok** | 1.18.38 | Code Generation |
 55	
 56	## Project Structure
 57	
 58	### Main Source (`src/main/java`)
 59	- **`base/`** - Contains BaseTest class with common setup and teardown methods
 60	- **`pages/`** - Page Object Model classes for each web page
 61	- **`utils/`** - Utility classes for common operations
 62	
 63	### Test Source (`src/test/java`)
 64	- **Test Classes** - Contains actual test methods
 65	- **Resources** - Configuration files and test data
 66	
 67	### ⚙️ Configuration
 68	- **`config/config.properties`** - Application configuration
 69	- **`testng.xml`** - TestNG suite configuration
 70	
 71	## Prerequisites
 72	
 73	- ☕ **Java 24** or higher
 74	- **Maven 3.6+**
 75	- **Chrome Browser** (latest version)
 76	- **IDE** (IntelliJ IDEA/Eclipse recommended)
 77	
 78	## Installation & Setup
 79	
 80	1. **Clone the repository:**
 81	 ```bash
 82	 git clone <repository-url>
 83	 cd AutomationExercise
 84	 ```
 85	
 86	2. **Install dependencies:**
 87	 ```bash
 88	 mvn clean install
 89	 ```
 90	
 91	3. **Verify setup:**
 92	 ```bash
 93	 mvn clean compile
 94	 ```

 139	 </classes>

 142	```
 143	
 144	## ‍♂️ Running Tests
 145	
 146	### Run All Tests
 147	```bash
 148	mvn clean test
 149	```
 150	
 151	### Run Specific Test Suite
 152	```bash
 153	mvn clean test -DsuiteXmlFile=testng.xml
 154	```
 155	
 156	### ️ Run in Headless Mode
 157	Set `headless=true` in config.properties or:
 158	```bash
 159	mvn clean test -Dheadless=true
 160	```
 161	
 162	### Run Specific Test Class
 163	```bash
 164	mvn clean test -Dtest=LoginFlowTest
 165	```
 166	
 167	### Run Specific Test Method
 168	```bash
 169	mvn clean test -Dtest=LoginFlowTest#verify_LoginSuccessfullyWithValidCredentials
 170	```

 172	## Test Reports
...
 181	
 182	### Surefire Reports
 183	- **Location:** `target/surefire-reports/`
 184	- **Format:** XML and TXT reports
 185	
 186	### Logs
 187	- **Location:** `logs/test-log.log`
 188	- **Level:** Configurable via log4j2.xml
 189	
 190	## ✨ Framework Features
 191	
 192	### Page Object Model (POM)
 193	- **Maintainable:** Easy to update locators and methods
 194	- **Reusable:** Page methods can be used across multiple tests
 195	- **Readable:** Clear separation of test logic and page interactions
 196	
 197	### Driver Management
 198	- **Auto-configuration:** Automatic browser setup
 199	- **Headless Support:** Run tests without UI
 200	- **Cross-browser:** Easy to extend for multiple browsers
 201	
 202	### Comprehensive Reporting
 203	- **ExtentReports:** Rich HTML reports with screenshots
 204	- **Logging:** Detailed execution logs
 205	- **Test Metrics:** Pass/Fail statistics and execution time
 206	
 207	### Test Data Generation
 208	- **Dynamic Data:** Random email, name, and address generation
 209	- **Realistic Data:** Indian names, cities, and phone numbers
 210	- **Configurable:** Easy to modify data patterns
 211	
 212	### Email Integration
 213	- **Notifications:** Send test results via email
 214	- **Attachments:** Include reports and logs
 215	- **Configurable:** SMTP settings in properties file

Path: SCREENSHOT_FEATURE.md
 1	# Screenshot on Failure Feature
 2	
 3	## Overview
 4	The automation framework now includes automatic screenshot capture functionality that triggers whenever a test fails. This feature helps in debugging test failures by providing visual evidence of the application state at the time of failure.
 5	
 6	## ✨ Features
 7	
 8	### Automatic Screenshot Capture
 9	- **Triggers:** Automatically captures screenshots when any test fails
 10	- **Location:** `test-output/screenshots/`
 11	- **Naming:** `FAILED_{testMethodName}_{timestamp}.png`
 12	- **Integration:** Screenshots are automatically attached to ExtentReports
...
 30	
 31	**Key Methods:**
 32	- `captureScreenshot()` - General screenshot capture
 33	- `captureFailureScreenshot()` - Specific for test failures
 34	- `cleanupOldScreenshots()` - Removes old screenshots
 35	- `getRelativeScreenshotPath()` - Formats paths for HTML reports
 36	
 37	#### 2. Enhanced BaseTest Class
 38	**Location:** `src/main/java/com/akshay/automationexecrices/base/BaseTest.java`
 39	
 40	**Updates:**
 41	- Modified `@AfterMethod` to capture screenshots on failure
 42	- Added automatic screenshot attachment to ExtentReports
 43	- Integrated cleanup functionality in `@BeforeSuite`
 44	
 45	#### 3. Dependencies Added
 46	**Location:** `pom.xml`
 47	- Added Apache Commons IO for file operations
 48	
 49	## How It Works

 1	package com.akshay.automationexecrices.utils;
 2	
 3	import com.akshay.automationexecrices.base.BaseTest;
 4	import org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver;
 5	import org.openqa.selenium.chrome.ChromeDriver;
 6	import org.openqa.selenium.chrome.ChromeOptions;
 7	
 8	import java.time.Duration;
 9	
 10	public class DriverManager extends BaseTest {
 11	 public static WebDriver webDriver;
 12	 private static String browserMode;
 13	
 14	 public static WebDriver initDriver(String browser){
 15	 ChromeOptions options = new ChromeOptions();
 16	
 17	
 18	 if ("true".equalsIgnoreCase(util.getProperty("headless"))) {
 19	 options.addArguments("--headless=new"); // or "--headless" for older Chrome
 20	 // Use new headless mode
 21	 options.addArguments("--window-size=1920,1080");
 22	 options.addArguments("--disable-gpu");
 23	 options.addArguments("--no-sandbox");
 24	 options.addArguments("--disable-dev-shm-usage");
 25	 System.out.println("✅ Headless mode enabled via config.properties");
 26	 browserMode = "Headless";
 27	 } else {
 28	 System.out.println("️ Headless mode disabled. Running with UI.");
 29	 browserMode = "UI";
 30	 }
 31	
 32	 if(browser.equalsIgnoreCase("chrome")){
 33	 webDriver = new ChromeDriver(options);
 34	 }
 35	
 36	 webDriver.manage().window().maximize();
 37	 webDriver.manage().timeouts().implicitlyWait(Duration.ofSeconds(20));
 38	 return webDriver;
 39	 }
 40	 public static String getBrowserMode() {
 41	 return browserMode;
 42	 }
 43	
 44	 public static WebDriver getWebDriver(){
 45	 return webDriver;
 46	 }
 47	}

 14	 WebDriver driver;

 22	
 23	 @FindBy(xpath = "//button[contains(text(),'Login')]")

 39	 }
 40	
 41	 public void enterLoginEmail(String name){
 42	 wait.until(ExpectedConditions.visibilityOf(inputLoginEmail));
 43	 inputLoginEmail.clear();
 44	 inputLoginEmail.sendKeys(name);
 45	 }
 46

 48	 wait.until(ExpectedConditions.visibilityOf(inputLoginPassword));
 49	 inputLoginPassword.clear();
 50	 inputLoginPassword.sendKeys(email);
 51	 }
 52	
 53	 public void clickLoginButton(){
 54	 wait.until(ExpectedConditions.elementToBeClickable(loginBtn)).click();
 55	 }

 59	 }

 63	 }
 64

...
 13	
 14	### File Management
 15	- **Directory Creation:** Automatically creates screenshots directory if it doesn't exist
 16	- **Cleanup:** Automatically removes screenshots older than 7 days
 17	- **Timestamping:** Each screenshot has a unique timestamp to avoid conflicts
 18	
 19	### ExtentReports Integration
 20	- **Automatic Attachment:** Failed test reports include clickable screenshot links
 21	- **Visual Evidence:** Screenshots appear directly in the HTML report
 22	- **Enhanced Debugging:** Failure logs include both error messages and visual proof
 23	
 24	## ️ Implementation Details

 26	### New Components Added

 28	#### 1. ScreenshotUtils Class
 29	**Location:** `src/main/java/com/akshay/automationexecrices/utils/ScreenshotUtils.java`

 32	- `captureScreenshot()` - General screenshot capture
 33	- `captureFailureScreenshot()` - Specific for test failures
 34	- `cleanupOldScreenshots()` - Removes old screenshots
 35	- `getRelativeScreenshotPath()` - Formats paths for HTML reports
 36	
 37	#### 2. Enhanced BaseTest Class
 38	**Location:** `src/main/java/com/akshay/automationexecrices/base/BaseTest.java`
 39	
 40	**Updates:**
 41	- Modified `@AfterMethod` to capture screenshots on failure
 42	- Added automatic screenshot attachment to ExtentReports
 43	- Integrated cleanup functionality in `@BeforeSuite`
 44	
 45	#### 3. Dependencies Added
 46	**Location:** `pom.xml`
 47	- Added Apache Commons IO for file operations

 1	package com.akshay.automationexecrices.utils;
 2	import java.io.*;
 3	import java.util.Properties;
 4	
 5	import java.io.FileInputStream;
 6	import java.io.IOException;
 7	import java.util.Properties;
 8	
 9	public class PropertyUtil {
 10	 private static PropertyUtil instance;
 11	 private Properties properties;
 12	
 13	 // Private constructor to prevent external instantiation
 14	 private PropertyUtil(String filePath) {
 15	 properties = new Properties();
 16	 try (FileInputStream fis = new FileInputStream(filePath)) {
 17	 properties.load(fis);
 18	 } catch (IOException e) {
 19	 e.printStackTrace();
 20	 throw new RuntimeException("Failed to load properties file: " + filePath);
 21	 }
 22	 }
 23	
 24	 // Get singleton instance (load only once)
 25	 public static PropertyUtil getInstance(String filePath) {
 26	 if (instance == null) {
 27	 instance = new PropertyUtil(filePath);
 28	 }
 29	 return instance;
 30	 }
 31	
 32	 // Getter for property value
 33	 public String getProperty(String key) {
 34	 return properties.getProperty(key);
 35	 }
 36	}

Path: src/main/java/com/akshay/automationexecrices/utils/MailUtils.java
 1	package com.akshay.automationexecrices.utils;
 2	
 3	import com.akshay.automationexecrices.base.BaseTest;
 4	import jakarta.mail.*;
 5	import jakarta.mail.internet.*;
 6	
 7	import java.io.File;
 8	import java.util.Properties;
 9	
 10	public class MailUtils extends BaseTest{
 11	
 12	 public static void sendEmailWithPdfReport(String pdfPath) {
 13	 final String fromEmail = util.getProperty("senderEmail"); // your email
 14	 final String password = util.getProperty("appPassword"); // use App Password for Gmail
 15	 final String toEmail = util.getProperty("receiverEmail"); // recipient email
 16	 final String subject = " Automation Test Report (PDF)";
 17	
 18	
 19	 Properties props = new Properties();
 20	 props.put("mail.smtp.host", "smtp.gmail.com");
 21	 props.put("mail.smtp.port", "587");
 22	 props.put("mail.smtp.auth", "true");
 23	 props.put("mail.smtp.starttls.enable", "true");
 24	
 25	 Session session = Session.getInstance(props, new Authenticator() {
 26	 protected PasswordAuthentication getPasswordAuthentication() {
 27	 return new PasswordAuthentication(fromEmail, password);
 28	 }
 29	 });
 30	
 31	 try {
 32	 Message message = new MimeMessage(session);
 33	 message.setFrom(new InternetAddress(fromEmail));
 34	 message.setRecipients(
 35	 Message.RecipientType.TO,
 36	 InternetAddress.parse(toEmail)
 37	 );
 38	 message.setSubject(subject);
 39	
 40	 MimeBodyPart messageBodyPart = new MimeBodyPart();
 41	 messageBodyPart.setText("Please find the attached PDF automation test report.");
 42	
 43	 MimeBodyPart attachmentPart = new MimeBodyPart();
 44	 attachmentPart.attachFile(new File(pdfPath));
 45	
 46	 Multipart multipart = new MimeMultipart();
 47	 multipart.addBodyPart(messageBodyPart);
 48	 multipart.addBodyPart(attachmentPart);
 49	
 50	 message.setContent(multipart);
 51	
 52	 Transport.send(message);
 53	 System.out.println("✅ Email sent with PDF report.");
 54	 } catch (Exception e) {
 55	 e.printStackTrace();
 56	 }
 57	 }
 58	}

 15	public class BaseTest {
 16	 protected WebDriver driver;

 18	 protected static ExtentReports extent;

 20	
 21	 @BeforeSuite
 22	 public void reportSetup() {
 23	 ExtentSparkReporter sparkReporter = new ExtentSparkReporter("test-output/AutomationExercise.html");
 24	 extent = new ExtentReports();
 25	 extent.attachReporter(sparkReporter);
 26	 extent.setSystemInfo("OS", System.getProperty("os.name"));

 29

 32	 @BeforeMethod

 35	 driver = DriverManager.initDriver(util.getProperty("browser"));
 36	 driver.get(util.getProperty("url"));
 37	 driver.manage().window().maximize();
 38	
 39	 // Create ExtentTest instance for current test
 40	 ExtentTest extentTest = extent.createTest(method.getName());
 41	 test.set(extentTest);
 42	 // ✅ Log the browser mode from DriverManager
 43	 test.get().info("Browser Mode: " + DriverManager.getBrowserMode());
 44	 // test.get().info("✅ Headless mode (from config): " + util.getProperty("headless"));
 45	 }
 46	
 47	 @AfterMethod
 48	 public void tearDown(ITestResult result){
 49	
 50	 if (result.getStatus() == ITestResult.SUCCESS) {
 51	 test.get().pass("Test Passed");
 52	 } else if (result.getStatus() == ITestResult.FAILURE) {
 53	 test.get().fail(result.getThrowable());
 54	 } else if (result.getStatus() == ITestResult.SKIP) {
 55	 test.get().skip("Test Skipped");
 56	 }
 57	 if(driver != null){
 58	 driver.quit();
 59	 }
 60	 }

 47	 @AfterMethod

 49	
 50	 if (result.getStatus() == ITestResult.SUCCESS) {
 51	 test.get().pass("Test Passed");
 52	 } else if (result.getStatus() == ITestResult.FAILURE) {
 53	 test.get().fail(result.getThrowable());
 54	 } else if (result.getStatus() == ITestResult.SKIP) {
 55	 test.get().skip("Test Skipped");
 56	 }
 57	 if(driver != null){
 58	 driver.quit();
 59	 }
 60	 }

 68	 }

 1	package com.akshay.automationexecrices.utils;
 2	
 3	import com.akshay.automationexecrices.base.BaseTest;
 4	import org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver;
 5	import org.openqa.selenium.chrome.ChromeDriver;
 6	import org.openqa.selenium.chrome.ChromeOptions;
 7	
 8	import java.time.Duration;
 9	
 10	public class DriverManager extends BaseTest {
 11	 public static WebDriver webDriver;
 12	 private static String browserMode;
 13	
 14	 public static WebDriver initDriver(String browser){
 15	 ChromeOptions options = new ChromeOptions();
 16	
 17	
 18	 if ("true".equalsIgnoreCase(util.getProperty("headless"))) {
 19	 options.addArguments("--headless=new"); // or "--headless" for older Chrome
 20	 // Use new headless mode
 21	 options.addArguments("--window-size=1920,1080");
 22	 options.addArguments("--disable-gpu");
 23	 options.addArguments("--no-sandbox");
 24	 options.addArguments("--disable-dev-shm-usage");
 25	 System.out.println("✅ Headless mode enabled via config.properties");
 26	 browserMode = "Headless";
 27	 } else {
 28	 System.out.println("️ Headless mode disabled. Running with UI.");
 29	 browserMode = "UI";
 30	 }
 31	
 32	 if(browser.equalsIgnoreCase("chrome")){
 33	 webDriver = new ChromeDriver(options);
 34	 }
 35	
 36	 webDriver.manage().window().maximize();
 37	 webDriver.manage().timeouts().implicitlyWait(Duration.ofSeconds(20));
 38	 return webDriver;
 39	 }
 40	 public static String getBrowserMode() {
 41	 return browserMode;
 42	 }
 43	
 44	 public static WebDriver getWebDriver(){
 45	 return webDriver;
 46	 }
 47	}

 1	package com.akshay.automationexecrices.utils;
 2	import java.io.*;
 3	import java.util.Properties;
 4	
 5	import java.io.FileInputStream;
 6	import java.io.IOException;
 7	import java.util.Properties;
 8	
 9	public class PropertyUtil {
 10	 private static PropertyUtil instance;
 11	 private Properties properties;
 12	
 13	 // Private constructor to prevent external instantiation
 14	 private PropertyUtil(String filePath) {
 15	 properties = new Properties();
 16	 try (FileInputStream fis = new FileInputStream(filePath)) {
 17	 properties.load(fis);
 18	 } catch (IOException e) {
 19	 e.printStackTrace();
 20	 throw new RuntimeException("Failed to load properties file: " + filePath);
 21	 }
 22	 }
 23	
 24	 // Get singleton instance (load only once)
 25	 public static PropertyUtil getInstance(String filePath) {
 26	 if (instance == null) {
 27	 instance = new PropertyUtil(filePath);
 28	 }
 29	 return instance;
 30	 }
 31	
 32	 // Getter for property value
 33	 public String getProperty(String key) {
 34	 return properties.getProperty(key);
 35	 }
 36	}

 1	# AutomationExercise Test Framework
 2	
 3	A comprehensive, enterprise-ready Selenium-based test automation framework built with Java, TestNG, and Maven. This framework follows industry best practices and provides robust testing capabilities for the [Automation Exercise](https://automationexercise.com) web application.
...
 41	
 42	| Technology | Version | Purpose |
 43	|------------|---------|---------|
 44	| **Java** | 24 | Programming Language |
 45	| **Selenium WebDriver** | 4.33.0 | Web Automation |
 46	| **TestNG** | 7.11.0 | Testing Framework |
 47	| **Maven** | 3.9.9+ | Build Tool & Dependency Management |
 48	| **ExtentReports** | 5.1.2 | Test Reporting |
 49	| **WebDriverManager** | 6.1.0 | Driver Management |
 50	| **Log4j** | 2.20.0 | Logging Framework |
 51	| **Apache Commons IO** | 2.11.0 | File Operations |
 52	| **Jakarta Mail** | 2.0.1 | Email Integration |
 53	| **Lombok** | 1.18.38 | Code Generation |
 54	
 55	## Project Structure
 56	
 57	```
 58	AutomationExercise/
 59	├── src/
 60	│ ├── main/java/com/akshay/automationexecrices/

 62	│ │ │ └── BaseTest.java # Common setup/teardown
 63	│ │ ├── pages/ # Page Object Model classes
 64	│ │ │ ├── HomePage.java

 66	│ │ │ └── SignupPage.java
 67	│ │ └── utils/ # Utility classes
 68	│ │ ├── DriverManager.java # WebDriver management
 69	│ │ ├── ScreenshotUtils.java # Screenshot functionality
 70	│ │ ├── CommonMethods.java # Test data generation
 71	│ │ ├── PropertyUtil.java # Configuration management
 72	│ │ ├── MailUtils.java # Email functionality
...
 88	├── logs/ # Application logs
 89	├── target/ # Maven build artifacts
 90	├── pom.xml # Maven dependencies
 91	├── testng.xml # TestNG suite configuration
 92	└── README.md # Project documentation
 93	```
 94	
 95	## Prerequisites
 96	
 97	- ☕ **Java 24** or higher
 98	- **Maven 3.6+**
 99	- **Chrome Browser** (latest version)
 100	- **IDE** (IntelliJ IDEA/Eclipse recommended)
 101	- **Internet Connection** (for WebDriverManager and dependencies)
 102	
 103	## Installation & Setup
 104	
 105	### 1. Clone the Repository
 106	```bash
 107	git clone <repository-url>
 108	cd AutomationExercise
 109	```
 110	
 111	### 2. Install Dependencies
 112	```bash
 113	mvn clean install
 114	```
 115	
 116	### 3. Verify Setup
 117	```bash
 118	mvn clean compile
 119	```
...
 153	
 154	# Email Configuration (for report notifications)
 155	senderEmail=sender@gmail.com
 156	receiverEmail=receiver@gmail.com
 157	appPassword=your-gmail-app-password
 158	```
 159	
 160	### TestNG Configuration
 161	Test execution is configured through `testng.xml`:
 162	
 163	```xml
 164	<suite name="AutomationExercise Test Suite">
 165	 <test name="Automation Tests">
 166	 <classes>
 167	 <class name="LoginFlowTest"/>
 168	 <class name="SignupFlowTest"/>
 169	 <class name="HomePageTest"/>
 170	 </classes>
 171	 </test>
 172	</suite>
 173	```
 174	
 175	## ‍♂️ Running Tests
 176	
 177	### Run All Tests
 178	```bash
 179	mvn clean test
 180	```
 181	
 182	### Run Specific Test Suite
 183	```bash
 184	mvn clean test -DsuiteXmlFile=testng.xml
 185	```
 186	
 187	### ️ Run in Headless Mode
 188	```bash
 189	mvn clean test -Dheadless=true
 190	```
 191	
 192	### Run Specific Test Class
 193	```bash
 194	mvn clean test -Dtest=LoginFlowTest
 195	```
 196	
 197	### Run Specific Test Method
 198	```bash
 199	mvn clean test -Dtest=LoginFlowTest#verify_LoginSuccessfullyWithValidCredentials
 200	```
 201	
 202	### Run Tests with Custom Browser
 203	```bash
 204	mvn clean test -Dbrowser=chrome
 205	```
 206	
 207	## Test Reports
 208	
 209	### ExtentReports
 210	- **Location:** `test-output/AutomationExercise.html`
 211	- **Features:** 
 212	 - Detailed test execution logs with step-by-step documentation
 213	 - **Automatic screenshots on test failures** (both embedded and linked)
 214	 - System information and environment details
 215	 - Test duration and execution statistics
 216	 - Interactive charts and graphs
 217	 - Professional presentation for stakeholders
...
 227	
 228	### Surefire Reports
 229	- **Location:** `target/surefire-reports/`
 230	- **Format:** XML and TXT reports for CI/CD integration
 231	
 232	### Logs
 233	- **Location:** `logs/test-log.log`
 234	- **Level:** Configurable via `log4j2.xml`
 235	
 236	### Viewing Reports
 237	For optimal screenshot display, use the built-in report server:
 238	```bash
 239	java -cp "target/classes;target/test-classes" com.akshay.automationexecrices.utils.ReportServer
 240	```
 241	Then open: `http://localhost:8080/AutomationExercise.html`
 242	
 243	Or use the batch file: `run-report-server.bat`
 244	
 245	## ✨ Framework Features
...
 381	
 382	### ✅ Reporting Standards
 383	- **Detailed Logging:** Step-by-step execution documentation
 384	- **Visual Evidence:** Screenshots for failure analysis and debugging
 385	- **Metrics Tracking:** Test execution statistics and trends
 386	- **Professional Format:** Business-ready report presentation
 387	- **Security Conscious:** Sensitive data masking in reports
 388	
 389	## Troubleshooting
 390	
 391	### Common Issues
 392	
 393	#### Screenshots Not Visible in Reports
 394	**Problem:** Screenshots appear as broken links in ExtentReports
 395	**Solution:** Use the built-in report server instead of opening HTML files directly:
 396	```bash
 397	java -cp "target/classes;target/test-classes" com.akshay.automationexecrices.utils.ReportServer
 398	```
...
 420	
 421	#### Build Failures
 422	**Problem:** Maven compilation or dependency issues
 423	**Solutions:**
 424	```bash
 425	# Clean and rebuild the project
 426	mvn clean compile
 427	mvn dependency:resolve
 428	
 429	# Check for dependency conflicts
 430	mvn dependency:tree
 431	```
 432	
 433	#### Headless Mode Issues
 434	**Problem:** Tests behave differently in headless vs UI mode
 435	**Solutions:**
 436	- Verify headless configuration in `config.properties`
 437	- Check window size settings for headless mode
 438	- Ensure all elements are properly loaded before interaction
 439	
 440	### Getting Help
 441	1. **Check Logs:** Review `logs/test-log.log` for detailed error information
 442	2. **ExtentReports:** Check the HTML report for step-by-step execution details
 443	3. **Configuration:** Verify all settings in `config/config.properties`
 444	4. **Prerequisites:** Ensure all required software is installed and updated
 445	5. **Dependencies:** Verify Maven dependencies are resolved correctly
 446	
 447	## Contributing
 448	
 449	### Guidelines
 450	1. **Fork** the repository and create a feature branch
 451	2. **Follow** existing coding standards and conventions
 452	3. **Add** appropriate tests for new functionality
 453	4. **Update** documentation for any changes
 454	5. **Test** thoroughly before submitting pull requests
 455	
 456	### Development Standards
 457	- Follow Java naming conventions and best practices
 458	- Add comprehensive JavaDoc comments for public methods
 459	- Maintain consistent code formatting and indentation
 460	- Include unit tests for utility methods and new features
 461	- Update README and documentation for new capabilities
 462	
 463	### Pull Request Process
 464	1. Create a feature branch: `git checkout -b feature/amazing-feature`
 465	2. Make your changes and commit: `git commit -m 'Add amazing feature'`
 466	3. Push to the branch: `git push origin feature/amazing-feature`
 467	4. Open a Pull Request with detailed description
 468	5. Ensure all tests pass and code review is complete

 1	package com.akshay.automationexecrices.base;
 2	
 3	import com.akshay.automationexecrices.utils.*;
 4	import com.aventstack.extentreports.ExtentReports;
 5	import com.aventstack.extentreports.ExtentTest;
 6	import com.aventstack.extentreports.reporter.ExtentSparkReporter;
 7	import org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver;
 8	import org.testng.ITestResult;
 9	import org.testng.annotations.*;
 10	
 11	import java.io.File;
 12	import java.io.IOException;
 13	import java.lang.reflect.Method;
 14	
 15	public class BaseTest {
 16	 protected WebDriver driver;
 17	 protected static PropertyUtil util;
 18	 protected static ExtentReports extent;
 19	 protected static ThreadLocal<ExtentTest> test = new ThreadLocal<>();
 20	
 21	 @BeforeSuite
 22	 public void reportSetup() {
 23	 ExtentSparkReporter sparkReporter = new ExtentSparkReporter("test-output/AutomationExercise.html");
 24	 extent = new ExtentReports();
 25	 extent.attachReporter(sparkReporter);
 26	 extent.setSystemInfo("OS", System.getProperty("os.name"));
 27	 extent.setSystemInfo("QA", "Akshay");
 28	
 29	
 30	 }
 31	
 32	 @BeforeMethod
 33	 public void setUp(Method method){
 34	 util = PropertyUtil.getInstance("config/config.properties");
 35	 driver = DriverManager.initDriver(util.getProperty("browser"));
 36	 driver.get(util.getProperty("url"));
 37	 driver.manage().window().maximize();
 38	
 39	 // Create ExtentTest instance for current test
 40	 ExtentTest extentTest = extent.createTest(method.getName());
 41	 test.set(extentTest);
 42	 // ✅ Log the browser mode from DriverManager
 43	 test.get().info("Browser Mode: " + DriverManager.getBrowserMode());
 44	 // test.get().info("✅ Headless mode (from config): " + util.getProperty("headless"));
 45	 }
 46	
 47	 @AfterMethod
 48	 public void tearDown(ITestResult result){
 49	
 50	 if (result.getStatus() == ITestResult.SUCCESS) {
 51	 test.get().pass("Test Passed");
 52	 } else if (result.getStatus() == ITestResult.FAILURE) {
 53	 test.get().fail(result.getThrowable());
 54	 } else if (result.getStatus() == ITestResult.SKIP) {
 55	 test.get().skip("Test Skipped");
 56	 }
 57	 if(driver != null){
 58	 driver.quit();
 59	 }
 60	 }
 61	
 62	 @AfterSuite
 63	 public void flushReport() throws InterruptedException, IOException {
 64	 // 1. Flush the Extent Report
 65	 if (BaseTest.extent != null) {
 66	 BaseTest.extent.flush();
 67	
 68	 }
 69	
 70	 }
 71	}

 1	package com.akshay.automationexecrices.pages;
 2	
 3	import org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver;
 4	import org.openqa.selenium.WebElement;
 5	import org.openqa.selenium.support.FindBy;
 6	import org.openqa.selenium.support.PageFactory;
 7	import org.openqa.selenium.support.ui.ExpectedConditions;
 8	import org.openqa.selenium.support.ui.WebDriverWait;
 9	
 10	import java.time.Duration;
 11	
 12	public class LoginPage {
 13	
 14	 WebDriver driver;
 15	 WebDriverWait wait;
 16	
 17	 @FindBy(xpath = "//form[@action='/login']/input[@name='email']")
 18	 private WebElement inputLoginEmail;
 19	
 20	 @FindBy(xpath = "//form[@action='/login']/input[@name='password']")
 21	 private WebElement inputLoginPassword;
 22	
 23	 @FindBy(xpath = "//button[contains(text(),'Login')]")
 24	 private WebElement loginBtn;
 25	
 26	 @FindBy(xpath = "//form/p[contains(text(),'Your email or password is incorrect!')]")
 27	 WebElement loginErrorMessage;
 28	
 29	 @FindBy(xpath = "//ul/li/a[contains(text(),' Logout')]")
 30	 WebElement logoutBtn;
 31	
 32	 @FindBy(xpath = "//h2[contains(text(),'Login to your account')]")
 33	 WebElement loginText;
 34	
 35	 public LoginPage(WebDriver driver){
 36	 this.driver = driver;
 37	 this.wait = new WebDriverWait(driver, Duration.ofSeconds(20));
 38	 PageFactory.initElements(driver, this);
 39	 }
 40	
 41	 public void enterLoginEmail(String name){
 42	 wait.until(ExpectedConditions.visibilityOf(inputLoginEmail));
 43	 inputLoginEmail.clear();
 44	 inputLoginEmail.sendKeys(name);
 45	 }
 46	
 47	 public void enterLoginPassword(String email){
 48	 wait.until(ExpectedConditions.visibilityOf(inputLoginPassword));
 49	 inputLoginPassword.clear();
 50	 inputLoginPassword.sendKeys(email);
 51	 }
 52	
 53	 public void clickLoginButton(){
 54	 wait.until(ExpectedConditions.elementToBeClickable(loginBtn)).click();
 55	 }
 56	
 57	 public String getLoginErrorMsg(){
 58	 return loginErrorMessage.getText();
 59	 }
 60	
 61	 public void clickLogout(){
 62	 wait.until(ExpectedConditions.elementToBeClickable(logoutBtn)).click();
 63	 }
 64	
 65	 public String loginTitle(){
 66	 wait.until(ExpectedConditions.visibilityOf(loginText));
 67	 return loginText.getText();
 68	 }
 69	}

 1	import com.akshay.automationexecrices.base.BaseTest;
 2	import com.akshay.automationexecrices.pages.HomePage;
 3	import com.akshay.automationexecrices.pages.LoginPage;
 4	import org.testng.Assert;
 5	import org.testng.annotations.BeforeMethod;
 6	import org.testng.annotations.Test;
 7	import org.apache.logging.log4j.LogManager;
 8	import org.apache.logging.log4j.Logger;
 9	
 10	public class LoginFlowTest extends BaseTest {
 11	
 12	 private static final String EXPECTED_LOGGED_USER_TITLE = "Logged in as akshay";
 13	 private static final String EXPECTED_INVALID_LOGIN_ERROR_MESSAGE = "Your email or password is incorrect!";
 14	 private HomePage homePage;
 15	 private LoginPage loginPage;
 16	
 17	 @BeforeMethod
 18	 public void pageSetup() {
 19	 loginPage = new LoginPage(driver);
 20	 homePage = new HomePage(driver);
 21	 }
 22	
 23	 @Test
 24	 public void verify_LoginSuccessfullyWithValidCredentials() throws Exception {
 25	 test.get().info("✅ Scenario: User logs in with valid credentials and is successfully authenticated.");
 26	 test.get().info("Test started: Verify login functionality with valid credentials");
 27	
 28	 // Step 1: Open the application URL
 29	 test.get().info("Step 1: Open the application URL: " + util.getProperty("url"));
 30	
 31	 // Step 2: Click on the signup/login button
 32	 test.get().info("Step 2: Click on the Sign Up / Login button");
 33	 homePage.clickLoginSignupButton();
 34	
 35	 // Step 3: Enter username
 36	 test.get().info("Step 3: Enter valid username: " + util.getProperty("username"));
 37	 loginPage.enterLoginEmail(util.getProperty("username"));
 38	
 39	 // Step 4: Enter password (hidden in logs)
 40	 test.get().info("Step 4: Enter valid password: ****** (hidden for security)");
 41	 loginPage.enterLoginPassword(util.getProperty("password"));
 42	
 43	 // Step 5: Click on the login button
 44	 test.get().info("Step 5: Click on the Login button");
 45	 loginPage.clickLoginButton();
 46	
 47	 // Step 6: Validate logged-in user
 48	 String actualLoggedInUserText = homePage.getLoggedInUsername();
 49	 test.get().info("Step 6: Validated logged-in user");
 50	 test.get().info("Actual logged-in user text: " + actualLoggedInUserText);
 51	
 52	 Assert.assertEquals(actualLoggedInUserText, EXPECTED_LOGGED_USER_TITLE, "Expected user to be '"+EXPECTED_LOGGED_USER_TITLE+"' but found: " + actualLoggedInUserText);
 53	
 54	 loginPage.clickLogout();
 55	 test.get().info("Step 7: Clicked on the logout button");
 56	
 57	 test.get().info("Test completed successfully: validLoginTest");
 58	 }
 59	
 60	 @Test
 61	 public void verify_ShowErrorOnInvalidCredentials() throws Exception {
 62	 test.get().info("❌ Scenario: User attempts to log in with invalid credentials and receives an error message.");
 63	 // Step 1: Open the application URL
 64	 test.get().info("Test started: Verify login functionality with invalid credentials");
 65	
 66	 test.get().info("Step 1: Open the application URL: " + util.getProperty("url"));
 67	
 68	 // Step 2: Click on the signup/login button
 69	 test.get().info("Step 2: Click on the Sign Up / Login button");
 70	 homePage.clickLoginSignupButton();
 71	
 72	 // Step 3: Enter invalid username
 73	 test.get().info("Step 3: Enter invalid username: " + "testuser");
 74	 loginPage.enterLoginEmail("testuser@t.com");
 75	
 76	 // Step 4: Enter invalid password (avoid logging sensitive info, but if necessary, log carefully)
 77	 test.get().info("Step 4: Enter invalid password: ****** (hidden for security)");
 78	 loginPage.enterLoginPassword("2122");
 79	
 80	 // Step 5: Click on the login button
 81	 test.get().info("Step 5: Click on the Login button");
 82	 loginPage.clickLoginButton();
 83	
 84	 // Step 6: Validate error message displayed for invalid login
 85	 String actualErrorMessage = loginPage.getLoginErrorMsg();
 86	 test.get().info("Step 6: Validate error message for invalid login");
 87	 test.get().info("Error message displayed: " + actualErrorMessage);
 88	
 89	 Assert.assertEquals(actualErrorMessage, EXPECTED_INVALID_LOGIN_ERROR_MESSAGE, "Error message mismatch!");
 90	
 91	 test.get().info("Test completed successfully: inValidLoginTest");
 92	 }
 93	}

 94	
 95	## Prerequisites
 96	
 97	- ☕ **Java 24** or higher
 98	- **Maven 3.6+**
 99	- **Chrome Browser** (latest version)
 100	- **IDE** (IntelliJ IDEA/Eclipse recommended)
 101	- **Internet Connection** (for WebDriverManager and dependencies)
 102	
 103	## Installation & Setup
 104	
 105	### 1. Clone the Repository
 106	```bash
 107	git clone <repository-url>
 108	cd AutomationExercise
 109	```
 110	
 111	### 2. Install Dependencies
 112	```bash
 113	mvn clean install
 114	```
 115	
 116	### 3. Verify Setup
 117	```bash
 118	mvn clean compile
 119	```

Path: src/main/java/com/akshay/automationexecrices/base/BaseTest.java
 1	package com.akshay.automationexecrices.base;
 2	
 3	import com.akshay.automationexecrices.utils.*;
 4	import com.aventstack.extentreports.ExtentReports;
 5	import com.aventstack.extentreports.ExtentTest;
 6	import com.aventstack.extentreports.reporter.ExtentSparkReporter;
 7	import org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver;
 8	import org.testng.ITestResult;
 9	import org.testng.annotations.*;
 10	
 11	import java.lang.reflect.Method;
 12	
 13	public class BaseTest {
 14	 protected WebDriver driver;
 15	 protected static PropertyUtil util;
 16	 protected static ExtentReports extent;
 17	 protected static ThreadLocal<ExtentTest> test = new ThreadLocal<>();
 18	
 19	 @BeforeSuite
 20	 public void reportSetup() {
 21	 ExtentSparkReporter sparkReporter = new ExtentSparkReporter("test-output/AutomationExercise.html");
 22	 extent = new ExtentReports();
 23	 extent.attachReporter(sparkReporter);
 24	 extent.setSystemInfo("OS", System.getProperty("os.name"));
 25	 extent.setSystemInfo("QA", "Akshay");
 26	
 27	
 28	 }
 29	
 30	 @BeforeMethod
 31	 public void setUp(Method method){
 32	 util = PropertyUtil.getInstance("config/config.properties");
 33	 driver = DriverManager.initDriver(util.getProperty("browser"));
 34	 driver.get(util.getProperty("url"));
 35	 driver.manage().window().maximize();
 36	
 37	 // Create ExtentTest instance for current test
 38	 ExtentTest extentTest = extent.createTest(method.getName());
 39	 test.set(extentTest);
 40	 // Log the browser mode from DriverManager
 41	 test.get().info("Browser Mode: " + DriverManager.getBrowserMode());
 42	 }
 43	
 44	 @AfterMethod
 45	 public void tearDown(ITestResult result){
 46	
 47	 if (result.getStatus() == ITestResult.SUCCESS) {
 48	 test.get().pass("Test Passed");
 49	 } else if (result.getStatus() == ITestResult.FAILURE) {
 50	 test.get().fail(result.getThrowable());
 51	 } else if (result.getStatus() == ITestResult.SKIP) {
 52	 test.get().skip("Test Skipped");
 53	 }
 54	 if(driver != null){
 55	 driver.quit();
 56	 }
 57	 }
 58	
 59	 @AfterSuite
 60	 public void flushReport() {
 61	 // Flush the Extent Report
 62	 if (BaseTest.extent != null) {
 63	 BaseTest.extent.flush();
 64	 }
 65	 }
 66	}

Path: src/main/java/com/akshay/automationexecrices/utils/DriverManager.java
 1	package com.akshay.automationexecrices.utils;
 2	
 3	import com.akshay.automationexecrices.base.BaseTest;
 4	import org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver;
 5	import org.openqa.selenium.chrome.ChromeDriver;
 6	import org.openqa.selenium.chrome.ChromeOptions;
 7	
 8	import java.time.Duration;
 9	
 10	public class DriverManager extends BaseTest {
 11	 public static WebDriver webDriver;
 12	 private static String browserMode;
 13	
 14	 public static WebDriver initDriver(String browser){
 15	 ChromeOptions options = new ChromeOptions();
 16	
 17	
 18	 if ("true".equalsIgnoreCase(util.getProperty("headless"))) {
 19	 options.addArguments("--headless=new"); // or "--headless" for older Chrome
 20	 // Use new headless mode
 21	 options.addArguments("--window-size=1920,1080");
 22	 options.addArguments("--disable-gpu");
 23	 options.addArguments("--no-sandbox");
 24	 options.addArguments("--disable-dev-shm-usage");
 25	 System.out.println("✅ Headless mode enabled via config.properties");
 26	 browserMode = "Headless";
 27	 } else {
 28	 System.out.println("️ Headless mode disabled. Running with UI.");
 29	 browserMode = "UI";
 30	 }
 31	
 32	 if(browser.equalsIgnoreCase("chrome")){
 33	 webDriver = new ChromeDriver(options);
 34	 }
 35	
 36	 webDriver.manage().window().maximize();
 37	 webDriver.manage().timeouts().implicitlyWait(Duration.ofSeconds(20));
 38	 return webDriver;
 39	 }
 40	 public static String getBrowserMode() {
 41	 return browserMode;
 42	 }
 43	
 44	 public static WebDriver getWebDriver(){
 45	 return webDriver;
 46	 }
 47	}

 94	
 95	## Prerequisites
 96	
 97	- ☕ **Java 24** or higher
 98	- **Maven 3.6+**
 99	- **Chrome Browser** (latest version)
 100	- **IDE** (IntelliJ IDEA/Eclipse recommended)
 101	- **Internet Connection** (for WebDriverManager and dependencies)
 102	
 103	## Installation & Setup
 104	
 105	### 1. Clone the Repository
 106	```bash
 107	git clone <repository-url>
 108	cd AutomationExercise
 109	```
 110	
 111	### 2. Install Dependencies
 112	```bash
 113	mvn clean install
 114	```
 115	
 116	### 3. Verify Setup
 117	```bash
 118	mvn clean compile
 119	```
...
 227	
 228	### Surefire Reports
 229	- **Location:** `target/surefire-reports/`
 230	- **Format:** XML and TXT reports for CI/CD integration
 231	
 232	### Logs
 233	- **Location:** `logs/test-log.log`
 234	- **Level:** Configurable via `log4j2.xml`
 235	
 236	### Viewing Reports
 237	For optimal screenshot display, use the built-in report server:
 238	```bash
 239	java -cp "target/classes;target/test-classes" com.akshay.automationexecrices.utils.ReportServer
 240	```
 241	Then open: `http://localhost:8080/AutomationExercise.html`
 242	
 243	Or use the batch file: `run-report-server.bat`
 244	
 245	## ✨ Framework Features
...
 279	
 280	### Security Features
 281	- **Credential Management:** Secure handling of sensitive data
 282	- **Configuration Externalization:** No hardcoded credentials in code
 283	- **Logging Security:** Sensitive data masked in logs (passwords shown as *****)
 284	- **Property-based Configuration:** Environment-specific settings
 285	
 286	## ️ Page Object Model
 287	
 288	### HomePage
 289	Handles home page interactions and navigation:
 290	- **Page title verification** for application validation
 291	- **Login/Signup navigation** to authentication pages
 292	- **User authentication status** validation after login
 293	- **Logged-in username display** verification

Path: src/main/java/com/akshay/automationexecrices/base/BaseTest.java
 1	package com.akshay.automationexecrices.base;
 2	
 3	import com.akshay.automationexecrices.utils.*;
 4	import com.aventstack.extentreports.ExtentReports;
 5	import com.aventstack.extentreports.ExtentTest;
 6	import com.aventstack.extentreports.reporter.ExtentSparkReporter;
 7	import org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver;
 8	import org.testng.ITestResult;
 9	import org.testng.annotations.*;
 10	
 11	import java.lang.reflect.Method;
 12	
 13	public class BaseTest {
 14	 protected WebDriver driver;
 15	 protected static PropertyUtil util;
 16	 protected static ExtentReports extent;
 17	 protected static ThreadLocal<ExtentTest> test = new ThreadLocal<>();
 18	
 19	 @BeforeSuite
 20	 public void reportSetup() {
 21	 ExtentSparkReporter sparkReporter = new ExtentSparkReporter("test-output/AutomationExercise.html");
 22	 extent = new ExtentReports();
 23	 extent.attachReporter(sparkReporter);
 24	 extent.setSystemInfo("OS", System.getProperty("os.name"));
 25	 extent.setSystemInfo("QA", "Akshay");
 26	
 27	
 28	 }
 29	
 30	 @BeforeMethod
 31	 public void setUp(Method method){
 32	 util = PropertyUtil.getInstance("config/config.properties");
 33	 driver = DriverManager.initDriver(util.getProperty("browser"));
 34	 driver.get(util.getProperty("url"));
 35	 driver.manage().window().maximize();
 36	
 37	 // Create ExtentTest instance for current test
 38	 ExtentTest extentTest = extent.createTest(method.getName());
 39	 test.set(extentTest);
 40	 // Log the browser mode from DriverManager
 41	 test.get().info("Browser Mode: " + DriverManager.getBrowserMode());
 42	 }
 43	
 44	 @AfterMethod
 45	 public void tearDown(ITestResult result){
 46	
 47	 if (result.getStatus() == ITestResult.SUCCESS) {
 48	 test.get().pass("Test Passed");
 49	 } else if (result.getStatus() == ITestResult.FAILURE) {
 50	 test.get().fail(result.getThrowable());
 51	 } else if (result.getStatus() == ITestResult.SKIP) {
 52	 test.get().skip("Test Skipped");
 53	 }
 54	 if(driver != null){
 55	 driver.quit();
 56	 }
 57	 }
 58	
 59	 @AfterSuite
 60	 public void flushReport() {
 61	 // Flush the Extent Report
 62	 if (BaseTest.extent != null) {
 63	 BaseTest.extent.flush();
 64	 }
 65	 }
 66	}

Path: src/main/java/com/akshay/automationexecrices/utils/DriverManager.java
 1	package com.akshay.automationexecrices.utils;
 2	
 3	import com.akshay.automationexecrices.base.BaseTest;
 4	import org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver;
 5	import org.openqa.selenium.chrome.ChromeDriver;
 6	import org.openqa.selenium.chrome.ChromeOptions;
 7	
 8	import java.time.Duration;
 9	
 10	public class DriverManager extends BaseTest {
 11	 public static WebDriver webDriver;
 12	 private static String browserMode;
 13	
 14	 public static WebDriver initDriver(String browser){
 15	 ChromeOptions options = new ChromeOptions();
 16	
 17	
 18	 if ("true".equalsIgnoreCase(util.getProperty("headless"))) {
 19	 options.addArguments("--headless=new"); // or "--headless" for older Chrome
 20	 // Use new headless mode
 21	 options.addArguments("--window-size=1920,1080");
 22	 options.addArguments("--disable-gpu");
 23	 options.addArguments("--no-sandbox");
 24	 options.addArguments("--disable-dev-shm-usage");
 25	 System.out.println("✅ Headless mode enabled via config.properties");
 26	 browserMode = "Headless";
 27	 } else {
 28	 System.out.println("️ Headless mode disabled. Running with UI.");
 29	 browserMode = "UI";
 30	 }
 31	
 32	 if(browser.equalsIgnoreCase("chrome")){
 33	 webDriver = new ChromeDriver(options);
 34	 }
 35	
 36	 webDriver.manage().window().maximize();
 37	 webDriver.manage().timeouts().implicitlyWait(Duration.ofSeconds(20));
 38	 return webDriver;
 39	 }
 40	 public static String getBrowserMode() {
 41	 return browserMode;
 42	 }
 43	
 44	 public static WebDriver getWebDriver(){
 45	 return webDriver;
 46	 }
 47	}

 2	
 3	import org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver;
 4	import org.openqa.selenium.WebElement;
 5	import org.openqa.selenium.support.FindBy;
 6	import org.openqa.selenium.support.PageFactory;
 7	import org.openqa.selenium.support.ui.ExpectedConditions;
 8	import org.openqa.selenium.support.ui.WebDriverWait;
 9	
 10	import java.time.Duration;
 11	
 12	public class HomePage {
 13	
 14	 WebDriver driver;
 15	 WebDriverWait wait;
 16	
 17	 @FindBy(xpath = "//ul[@class='nav navbar-nav']/li/a[contains(text(),'Signup / Login')]")
 18	 private WebElement loginSignupBtn;
 19	
 20	 @FindBy(xpath = "//ul[@class='nav navbar-nav']/li[10]/a")
 21	 private WebElement loggedInUsername;
 22	
 23	 public HomePage(WebDriver driver){
 24	 this.driver = driver;
 25	 this.wait = new WebDriverWait(driver, Duration.ofSeconds(20));
 26	 PageFactory.initElements(driver, this);
 27	 }
 28	
 29	 public String getTitle(){
 30	 return driver.getTitle();
 31	 }
 32	
 33	 public void clickLoginSignupButton(){
 34	 wait.until(ExpectedConditions.elementToBeClickable(loginSignupBtn)).click();
 35	 }
 36	
 37	 public String getLoggedInUsername(){
 38	 return loggedInUsername.getText();
 39	 }
 40	
 41	}

 1	package com.akshay.automationexecrices.utils;
 2	
 3	import com.akshay.automationexecrices.base.BaseTest;
 4	import jakarta.mail.*;
 5	import jakarta.mail.internet.*;
 6	
 7	import java.io.File;
 8	import java.util.Properties;
 9	
 10	public class MailUtils extends BaseTest{
 11	
 12	 public static void sendEmailWithPdfReport(String pdfPath) {
 13	 final String fromEmail = util.getProperty("senderEmail"); // your email
 14	 final String password = util.getProperty("appPassword"); // use App Password for Gmail
 15	 final String toEmail = util.getProperty("receiverEmail"); // recipient email
 16	 final String subject = " Automation Test Report (PDF)";
 17	
 18	
 19	 Properties props = new Properties();
 20	 props.put("mail.smtp.host", "smtp.gmail.com");
 21	 props.put("mail.smtp.port", "587");
 22	 props.put("mail.smtp.auth", "true");
 23	 props.put("mail.smtp.starttls.enable", "true");
 24	
 25	 Session session = Session.getInstance(props, new Authenticator() {
 26	 protected PasswordAuthentication getPasswordAuthentication() {
 27	 return new PasswordAuthentication(fromEmail, password);
 28	 }
 29	 });
 30	
 31	 try {
 32	 Message message = new MimeMessage(session);
 33	 message.setFrom(new InternetAddress(fromEmail));
 34	 message.setRecipients(
 35	 Message.RecipientType.TO,
 36	 InternetAddress.parse(toEmail)
 37	 );
 38	 message.setSubject(subject);
 39	
 40	 MimeBodyPart messageBodyPart = new MimeBodyPart();
 41	 messageBodyPart.setText("Please find the attached PDF automation test report.");
 42	
 43	 MimeBodyPart attachmentPart = new MimeBodyPart();
 44	 attachmentPart.attachFile(new File(pdfPath));
 45	
 46	 Multipart multipart = new MimeMultipart();
 47	 multipart.addBodyPart(messageBodyPart);
 48	 multipart.addBodyPart(attachmentPart);
 49	
 50	 message.setContent(multipart);
 51	
 52	 Transport.send(message);
 53	 System.out.println("✅ Email sent with PDF report.");
 54	 } catch (Exception e) {
 55	 e.printStackTrace();
 56	 }
 57	 }
 58	}

 120	
 121	### 4. Run Sample Test
 122	```bash
 123	mvn test -Dtest=HomePageTest
 124	```
 125	
 126	## ⚙️ Configuration
 127	
 128	### Configuration File
 129	All test configurations are managed through `config/config.properties`. Update this file with your test environment details:
 130	
 131	```properties
 132	# Browser Configuration
 133	browser=chrome
 134	headless=false
 135	
 136	# Application URL
 137	url=https://automationexercise.com
 138	
 139	# Test User Credentials (for existing user login tests)
 140	username=your-test-email@domain.com
 141	password=your-test-password
 142	
 143	# User Registration Data (for new user signup tests)
 144	userEmail=test-email@yopmail.com
 145	userFirstName=TestFirstName
 146	userLastName=TestLastName
 147	userMobileNumber=1234567890
 148	userStreet=Test Street
 149	userCity=Test City
 150	userState=Test State
 151	userZipcode=123456
 152	userPassword=test-password
 153	
 154	# Email Configuration (for report notifications)
 155	senderEmail=sender@gmail.com
 156	receiverEmail=receiver@gmail.com
 157	appPassword=your-gmail-app-password
 158	```
 159	
 160	### TestNG Configuration
 161	Test execution is configured through `testng.xml`:
 162	
 163	```xml
 164	<suite name="AutomationExercise Test Suite">
 165	 <test name="Automation Tests">
 166	 <classes>
 167	 <class name="LoginFlowTest"/>
 168	 <class name="SignupFlowTest"/>
 169	 <class name="HomePageTest"/>
 170	 </classes>
 171	 </test>
 172	</suite>
 173	```
 174	
 175	## ‍♂️ Running Tests
 176	
 177	### Run All Tests
 178	```bash
 179	mvn clean test
 180	```
 181	
 182	### Run Specific Test Suite
 183	```bash
 184	mvn clean test -DsuiteXmlFile=testng.xml
 185	```
 186	
 187	### ️ Run in Headless Mode
 188	```bash
 189	mvn clean test -Dheadless=true
 190	```
 191	
 192	### Run Specific Test Class
 193	```bash
 194	mvn clean test -Dtest=LoginFlowTest
 195	```

 1	package com.akshay.automationexecrices.utils;
 2	import java.io.*;
 3	import java.util.Properties;
 4	
 5	import java.io.FileInputStream;
 6	import java.io.IOException;
 7	import java.util.Properties;
 8	
 9	public class PropertyUtil {
 10	 private static PropertyUtil instance;
 11	 private Properties properties;
 12	
 13	 // Private constructor to prevent external instantiation
 14	 private PropertyUtil(String filePath) {
 15	 properties = new Properties();
 16	 try (FileInputStream fis = new FileInputStream(filePath)) {
 17	 properties.load(fis);
 18	 } catch (IOException e) {
 19	 e.printStackTrace();
 20	 throw new RuntimeException("Failed to load properties file: " + filePath);
 21	 }
 22	 }
 23	
 24	 // Get singleton instance (load only once)
 25	 public static PropertyUtil getInstance(String filePath) {
 26	 if (instance == null) {
 27	 instance = new PropertyUtil(filePath);
 28	 }
 29	 return instance;
 30	 }
 31	
 32	 // Getter for property value
 33	 public String getProperty(String key) {
 34	 return properties.getProperty(key);
 35	 }
 36	}

 1	package com.akshay.automationexecrices.base;
 2	
 3	import com.akshay.automationexecrices.utils.*;
 4	import com.aventstack.extentreports.ExtentReports;
 5	import com.aventstack.extentreports.ExtentTest;
 6	import com.aventstack.extentreports.reporter.ExtentSparkReporter;
 7	import org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver;
 8	import org.testng.ITestResult;
 9	import org.testng.annotations.*;
 10	
 11	import java.lang.reflect.Method;
 12	
 13	public class BaseTest {
 14	 protected WebDriver driver;
 15	 protected static PropertyUtil util;
 16	 protected static ExtentReports extent;
 17	 protected static ThreadLocal<ExtentTest> test = new ThreadLocal<>();
 18	
 19	 @BeforeSuite
 20	 public void reportSetup() {
 21	 ExtentSparkReporter sparkReporter = new ExtentSparkReporter("test-output/AutomationExercise.html");
 22	 extent = new ExtentReports();
 23	 extent.attachReporter(sparkReporter);
 24	 extent.setSystemInfo("OS", System.getProperty("os.name"));
 25	 extent.setSystemInfo("QA", "Akshay");
 26	
 27	
 28	 }
 29	
 30	 @BeforeMethod
 31	 public void setUp(Method method){
 32	 util = PropertyUtil.getInstance("config/config.properties");
 33	 driver = DriverManager.initDriver(util.getProperty("browser"));
 34	 driver.get(util.getProperty("url"));
 35	 driver.manage().window().maximize();
 36	
 37	 // Create ExtentTest instance for current test
 38	 ExtentTest extentTest = extent.createTest(method.getName());
 39	 test.set(extentTest);
 40	 // Log the browser mode from DriverManager
 41	 test.get().info("Browser Mode: " + DriverManager.getBrowserMode());
 42	 }
 43	
 44	 @AfterMethod
 45	 public void tearDown(ITestResult result){
 46	
 47	 if (result.getStatus() == ITestResult.SUCCESS) {
 48	 test.get().pass("Test Passed");
 49	 } else if (result.getStatus() == ITestResult.FAILURE) {
 50	 test.get().fail(result.getThrowable());
 51	 } else if (result.getStatus() == ITestResult.SKIP) {
 52	 test.get().skip("Test Skipped");
 53	 }
 54	 if(driver != null){
 55	 driver.quit();
 56	 }
 57	 }
 58	
 59	 @AfterSuite
 60	 public void flushReport() {
 61	 // Flush the Extent Report
 62	 if (BaseTest.extent != null) {
 63	 BaseTest.extent.flush();
 64	 }
 65	 }
 66	}
